member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder
member.summary:
CommandBuilder wraps an underlying SQL statement and the associated parameters.
Allows to easily add new clauses to underlying statement and also add new parameters.

member.name: F:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder._lineBreaksRegex
member.summary: Identify all types of line-breaks

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary: New CommandBuilder.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
New CommandBuilder based on an initial command.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.AddParameter(System.String,System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Data.DbType},System.Nullable{System.Data.ParameterDirection},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Byte},System.Nullable{System.Byte})
member.summary: Adds single parameter to current Command Builder.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.AddDynamicParams(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds the properties of an object (like a POCO) to current Command Builder. Does not check for name clashes.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.MergeParameter(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds single parameter to current Command Builder.
Checks for name clashes, and will rename parameter if necessary.
If parameter is renamed the new name will be returned, else returns null.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.Append(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Appends a statement to the current command.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.Replace(System.String,System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Replaces a text by a replacement text

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.AdjustMultilineString(System.String)
member.summary: Given a text block (multiple lines), this removes the left padding of the block, by calculating the minimum number of spaces which happens in EVERY line. Then, other methods writes the lines one by one, which in case will respect the current indent of the writer.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.AppendLine(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Appends a statement to the current command, but before statement adds a linebreak.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.Sql
member.summary: SQL of Command

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.CommandBuilder.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters of Command

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.DynamicParametersExtensions
member.summary: Extensions over DynamicParamters

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.DynamicParametersExtensions.MergeParameter(Dapper.DynamicParameters,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Adds single parameter to DynamicParameters.
Checks for name clashes, and will rename parameter if necessary.
If parameter is renamed the new name will be returned, else returns null.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.DynamicParametersExtensions.MergeParameters(Dapper.DynamicParameters,Dapper.DynamicParameters,System.String)
member.summary:
Merges multiple parameters into this CommandBuilder.
Checks for name clashes, and will rename parameters (in the CommandBuilder only) if necessary.
If some parameter is renamed the returned Sql statement will containg the original sql replaced with new names, else (if nothing changed) returns null.
This method does NOT append Parser SQL to CommandBuilder SQL (you may want to save this SQL statement elsewhere)

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filter
member.summary:
Filter statement defined in a single statement
It can include multiple conditions (if defined in a single statement during constructor),
but usually this is used as one condition (one column, one comparison operator, and one parameter).

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filter.Sql
member.summary: Formatted SQL statement using parameters (@p0, @p1, etc)

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filter.Parameters
member.summary: Dictionary of Dapper parameters

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filter.#ctor(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
New Filter statement.
Example: $"[CategoryId] = {categoryId}"
Example: $"[Name] LIKE {productName}"

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters
member.summary: Multiple Filter statements which are grouped together. Can be grouped with ANDs or ORs.

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.Type
member.summary: By default Filter Groups are combined with AND operator. But you can use OR.

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.FiltersType
member.summary: How a list of Filters are combined (AND operator or OR operator)

member.name: F:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.FiltersType.AND
member.summary: AND

member.name: F:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.FiltersType.OR
member.summary: OR

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.#ctor(Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.FiltersType,System.FormattableString[])
member.summary: Create a new group of filters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.#ctor(System.FormattableString[])
member.summary: Create a new group of filters which are combined with AND operator.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters.BuildFilters(Dapper.DynamicParameters)
member.summary:
If you're using Filters in standalone structure (without QueryBuilder),
you can just "build" the filters over a DynamicParameters and get the string for the filters (with leading WHERE)

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder
member.summary: FluentQueryBuilder allows to build queries using a Fluent-API interface

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary:
New empty FluentQueryBuilder.
Should be constructed using .Select(), .From(), .Where(), etc.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Select(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Adds one column to the select clauses

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Select(System.FormattableString[])
member.summary: Adds one or more columns to the select clauses

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.SelectDistinct(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Adds one column to the select clauses, and defines that query is a SELECT DISTINCT type

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.SelectDistinct(System.FormattableString[])
member.summary: Adds one or more columns to the select clauses, and defines that query is a SELECT DISTINCT type

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.From(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Adds a new table to from clauses.
"FROM" word is optional.
You can add an alias after table name.
You can also add INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, etc (with the matching conditions).

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.OrderBy(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Adds a new column to orderby clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.GroupBy(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Adds a new column to groupby clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Having(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Adds a new condition to having clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Limit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds offset and rowcount clauses

member.summary: Adds a new condition to where clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Where(Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters)
member.summary: Adds a new condition to where clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.FluentQueryBuilder.Where(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Adds a new condition to where clauses.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IDbConnectionExtensions
member.summary: Extends IDbConnection to easily build QueryBuilder or FluentQueryBuilder

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IDbConnectionExtensions.QueryBuilder(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary: Creates a new empty FluentQueryBuilder over current connection

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IDbConnectionExtensions.QueryBuilder(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Creates a new QueryBuilder over current connection
member.param:
You can use "{where}" or "/**where**/" in your query, and it will be replaced by "WHERE + filters" (if any filter is defined).
You can use "{filters}" or "/**filters**/" in your query, and it will be replaced by "filters" (without where) (if any filter is defined).

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IDbConnectionExtensions.CommandBuilder(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Creates a new CommandBuilder over current connection

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IFilter
member.summary: Can be both individual filter or a list of filters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IFilter.WriteFilter(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Writes the SQL Statement of the filter

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.IFilter.MergeParameters(Dapper.DynamicParameters)
member.summary:
Merges parameters from this filter into a CommandBuilder.
Checks for name clashes, and will rename parameters (in CommandBuilder) if necessary.
If some parameter is renamed the underlying Sql statement will have the new parameter names replaced by their new names.
This method does NOT append Parser SQL to CommandBuilder SQL (you may want to save this SQL statement elsewhere)

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser
member.summary: Parses an interpolated-string SQL statement into a injection-safe statement (with parameters as @p0, @p1, etc) and a dictionary of parameter values.

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser.Sql
member.summary: Injection-safe statement, with parameters as @p0, @p1, etc.

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser.Parameters
member.summary: Dictionary of Dapper parameters

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser.AutoGeneratedParameterPrefix
member.summary:
By default your interpolated strings will generate parameters like @p0, @p1, etc.
If your database does not accept @ you can change for anything else.
Example: if you set as ":Parameter" you'll get :Parameter1, :Parameter2, etc.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser.#ctor(System.FormattableString)
member.summary: Parses an interpolated-string SQL statement into a injection-safe statement (with parameters as @p0, @p1, etc) and a dictionary of parameter values.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.InterpolatedStatementParser.MergeParameters(Dapper.DynamicParameters)
member.summary:
Merges parameters from this query/statement into a CommandBuilder.
Checks for name clashes, and will rename parameters (in CommandBuilder) if necessary.
If some parameter is renamed the underlying Sql statement will have the new parameter names replaced by their new names.
This method does NOT append Parser SQL to CommandBuilder SQL (you may want to save this SQL statement elsewhere)

member.name: T:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder
member.summary:
Query Builder wraps an underlying SQL statement and the associated parameters.
Allows to easily add new clauses to underlying statement and also add new parameters.
On top of that it also loads a "Filters" property which can track a list of filters
which are later combined (by default with AND) and will replace the keyword /**where**/

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.FiltersType
member.summary: How a list of Filters are combined (AND operator or OR operator)

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary:
New empty QueryBuilder.
Query should be built using .Append(), .AppendLine(), or .Where().
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters. Where filters will later replace /**where**/ keyword

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
New QueryBuilder based on an initial query.
Query can be modified using .Append(), .AppendLine(), .Where().
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters. Where filters will later replace /**where**/ keyword
member.param:
You can use "{where}" or "/**where**/" in your query, and it will be replaced by "WHERE + filters" (if any filter is defined).
You can use "{filters}" or "/**filters**/" in your query, and it will be replaced by "AND filters" (without where) (if any filter is defined).

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Where(Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filter)
member.summary: Adds a new condition to where clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Where(Libraries.DapperBuilder.Filters)
member.summary: Adds a new condition to where clauses.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Where(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Adds a new condition to where clauses.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.GetFilters
member.summary:
Writes the SQL Statement of all filter(s) (going recursively if there are nested filters)
Does NOT add leading "WHERE" keyword.
Returns null if no filter was defined.

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters of Query

member.name: P:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Connection
member.summary: Underlying connection

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.Append(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Appends a statement to the current command.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.

member.name: M:Libraries.DapperBuilder.QueryBuilder.AppendLine(System.FormattableString)
member.summary:
Appends a statement to the current command, but before statement adds a linebreak.
Parameters embedded using string-interpolation will be automatically converted into Dapper parameters.
